oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Approximate Methods for Estimating Hysteretic Energy Demand on Plan-Asymmetric Buildings
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: RATHORE, M
CHOWDHURY, AR
GHOSH, S
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: MODAL PUSHOVER ANALYSIS
LOW-CYCLE FATIGUE
SEISMIC ANALYSIS
SYSTEMS
Hysteretic Energy Demand
Asymmetric Structures
Modal Pushover Analysis
2D-MPA
Energy-Based Design
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The first step in a hysteretic energy-based design approach of performance-based design is the estimation of hysteretic energy demand in the structure. A nonlinear response-history analysis of the multi-degree of freedom model gives an accurate estimation, but it is not suitable for adopting in design. Two alternative methods, based on the concepts of modal pushover analysis (MPA) and 2D-MPA, are proposed in this article for uniaxial plan-asymmetric structures. Application studies show that both methods are efficient. While the 2D-MPA-based method is more accurate, the MPA-based method is more suitable for design adoption. Significant conclusions are given for prospective application of these methods.
